crochet hook w/worsted size 4 chain- chain yarn chsp- chain space yarn min 3 colors single_crochet- single_crochet a stamen color half_double_crochet- half_double_crochet b petal color double_crochet- double_crochet c leaf color treble_crochet-treble_crochet yarn needle fp- front post scissors bp- back post shbp- shallow back post decrease- together ij- invisible join fo- fasten_off ©2024 christine anne melvin/womanwalkingawire 1 notes when a round starts with a new color i use standing stitches this is why you won t see me instructing you to start with chains you can start with a chain of equivalent height if you prefer half_double_crochet=ch2 double_crochet=ch3 edc/treble_crochet=ch4 but i think the standing stitch looks best see recommended resources for videos on how to make standing stitches chains between stitches do not count in the stitch count of a round unless otherwise directed or noted they are chain spaces chsps why do i tell you slip_stitch or ij invisible join at the end of some rounds it s my personal preference to make an invisible join when i fasten_off fo because i think it looks cleaner you can choose to do whichever method you prefer see recommended resources for videos on how to make an invisible join these pentagon granny s in dk yarn are approximately 6 inches from the tallest points and 4 ½ inches on each of the sides but will vary in size depending on materials used in worsted weight they are approximately 7 inches from the tallest points and 5 ½ inches along each of the sides recommended resources youtube links for invisible join & standing stitches by crystals and crochet youtube link for shallow back post stitch & more by tamara kelly of moogly blog keep in mind that she demonstrates a shallow back post stitch in a double_crochet and in this pattern we will be doing this stitch in single_crochet full video link to strawberry blossom granny pentagon https //vimeo com/931168391/8f1f6af75b ©2024 christine anne
